hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH 20-day Z-score mean reversion with regime filter
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling Z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±1.5 standard deviations from its mean during NEUTRAL or BULL regimes, a pairs trade (long underperformer/short outperformer) will generate positive returns with a Sharpe ratio >1.2 over the subsequent 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain a stable long-term correlation (0.85-0.95) but experience temporary divergences during neutral/bull regimes due to differing news flows or rotation between 'digital gold' and 'smart contract platform' narratives. These divergences tend to mean-revert within 1-2 weeks absent regime change.
entry_conditions: 20-day rolling Z-score of BTC/ETH ratio > 1.5 OR < -1.5
No major crypto-specific news events in past 24h
Entry at market open following signal
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean reversion fails >40% of time during NEUTRAL regimes OR average holding period return <0 after transaction costs.
